com.magnet.core.api

Interface RequiredService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContextBuilderDecorator, Controller, JettyStatisticsMXBean, LoggedInUserController, MagnetMBean, WebContainerStatisticsMXBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    com.magnet.web.core.spi.impl.AbstractWebContainer, JettyService

    @Contract
public interface RequiredService
    When used on a class declaration, a non-optional declaration has special meaning to the DI machinery. If after startup a required service was not used by some other service, an exception is thrown indicating a violation in some system level integrity rule.

    For instance, consider a service to advertise itself as a "listener". To promote good modular design it is usually sufficient to simply declare oneself as a listener without needing to couple (i.e., register) to a particular event publisher on the system - especially considering there may be multiple publishers on the system. By declaring the listener as non-optional, you are ensuring that the DI machinery will report exceptions when there is no event publisher on the system using the listener.
